PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A caracterizaзгo da espйcie transmissora e o agente etiolуgico responsбvel pela ocorrкncia de uma doenзa como a Leishmaniose em uma determinada бrea й de suma importвncia para a saъde pъblica, principalmente em se tratando da Amazфnia, onde o acesso aos centros mйdicos й complicado e laborioso. A regiгo ainda tem um outro agravante, que sгo suas fronteiras, com livre acesso com outros paises, por exemplo, a Venezuela e Colфmbia, tornando-se ainda mais amplo o surgimento e/ou notificaзгo de outras espйcies de flagelados nгo autуctones, assim como outras doenзas. A realizaзгo de um diagnуstico biolуgico e molecular e a escolha de um melhor mйtodo para a detecзгo da infecзгo nos insetos incriminados como vetores de leishmanioses e na populaзгo humana em uma regiгo de fronteira como Sгo Gabriel da Cachoeira й de suma importвncia para a compreensгo da dinвmica desta doenзa nessa бrea, uma vez que segundo a Organizaзгo Mundial da Saъde a leishmaniose й a segunda doenзa infecto-parasitбria de maior importвncia, perdendo apenas pela malбria. Este fato aliado a distвncia dos grandes centros dificultando a realizaзгo de um diagnуstico mais preciso e o conhecimento das espйcies de leishmanias na regiгo de Sгo Gabriel da Cachoeira em muito irгo contribuir para a Saъde Pъblica do Paнs assim como para o mapeamento das espйcies que circulam numa бrea estratйgica e de interesse como esta que й fronteira do Brasil. Como jб citado anteriormente, a fronteira й uma zona ou бrea que apresenta duas caracterнsticas bбsicas no que se refere aos processos saъde/doenзa que aн se estabelecem: a) й o lugar de entrada ou saнda de pessoas e mercadorias que permitem o intercвmbio e a difusгo de agentes patogкnicos entre paнses e; b) uma бrea ou zona com caracterнsticas particulares, onde os habitantes dos paнses vizinhos vivem os efeitos de proximidade, gerando comportamentos particulares (LEONARDI, 2001). PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Novos nanocompositos inorgвnicos e biorgвnicos com aplicaзгo nas бreas biomйdica e de engenharia.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O principal objetivo do presente Projeto й estabelecer uma colaboraзгo de longa duraзгo, fornecer a possibilidade para a transferкncia de conhecimentos, permitir trocas de pessoal envolvido nas pesquisas e criar uma rede intercontinental na бrea de nanocompositos inorgano-bioorganicos hнbridos para fins biomйdicas e aplicaзгo na engenharia. Execuзгo do Projeto levarб ao desenvolvimento de novos nanobiocompуsitos que sгo baseados em componentes naturais especнficos de regiхes particulares do Brasil e Бfrica do Sul. A expertise do consorcio de parceiros й mutuamente complementar. Engloba a sнntese de nanocompуsitos precursores (EOK-HY), sua modificaзгo e melhoramento de abordagens sintйticas para a sнntese de nanocompуsitos hнbridos (IOC-NAS), isolamento e caracterizaзгo de compostos ativos naturais e fibras de origem vegetal (IMA-UFRJ, INPA, ICGEB-UCT) que estгo acoplados com o desenvolvimento de nanofases avanзadas e nanocompositos hнbridos (EOK-HY, ICIS-CNR, ICTP-CNR, IMA-UFRJ). O alvo principal do Projeto consiste no desenvolvimento de nanocompositos inorgano-bioorgвnicos de alto valor agregado e baseado no conhecimento, materiais naturais e materiais idкnticos а natureza vetores de drug delivery, substвncias farmacologicamente ativos, fуrmulas farmacкuticas e cosmйticas atravйs da valorizaзгo dos recursos naturais regionais e expertise cientifica. Nanocompуsitos inovativos e seus componentes novos serгo caracterizados utilizando instalaзхes e equipamentos estado da arte em todas as organizaзхes parceiras para estudos na escala de nano abrangentes, nas бreas de fнsico-quнmica, mecвnica, espectroscуpicas e microscуpica alйm de estudos in vitro da atividade anti-cвncer, anti-parasitбrio, inseticida e antimicrobiana (INPA, ICGEB-UCT) e testes in vivo (ICGEB-UCT). Assuntos йticos relacionados а pesquisas serгo abordados. Os resultados do Projeto fortalecerгo o potencial cientнfico do ERA, contribuirгo para o desenvolvimento sustentбvel nos paнses participantes e promo
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The principal objective of the present Project is to establish a long-lasting collaboration, to provide a possibility for transfer of knowledge, to enable exchanges of research personnel, and to create an intercontinental network in the area of hybrid inorgano-bioorganic nanocomposites for biomedical and engineering applications. Realization of the Project will lead to the development of novel nanobiocomposites, which are based on natural components specific for particular regions of Brazil and South Africa. The expertise of the consortium partners is mutually complementary, it encompasses synthesis of the nanocomposite precursors (EOK-HY), their modification and improvement of synthetic approaches to hybrid nanocomposites (IOC-NAS), isolation and characterization of natural active compounds and fibres of plant origin (IMA-UFRJ, INPA, ICGEB-UCT) that are coupled with the development of advanced nanophases and hybrid nanocomposites (EOK-HY, ICISCNR, ICTP-CNR, IMA-UFRJ). Main scientific goal of Project consists in the development of knowledge-based high-added value inorgano-bioorganic nanocomposites, natural and nature identical materials, drug delivery vectors, pharmaceutically active compounds, pharmaceutical and cosmetic formulas through valorisation of regional natural resources and scientific expertise. Innovative nanocomposites and their novel components will be characterized using up-to-date facilities available at all partner organizations for comprehensive physico-chemical, mechanical, spectroscopic, and microscopic studies at the nano-scale; followed by assessment of their anticancer, anti-parasite, insecticide and antimicrobial performance in in-vitro (INPA, ICGEB-UCT) and in-vivo tests (ICGEB-UCT). Ethical issues of the research will be duly addressed. Results of the Project will strengthen the scientific potential of ERA, will contribute to the sustainable development in participating countries and promote regional development of the Partner Countries.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Manutenзгo de Equipamentos do Laboratуrio de Leishmaniose e Doenзa de Chagas ? CSAS - INPA
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
O presente projeto possui como proposta a manutenзгo preventiva e corretiva dos equipamentos utilizados nas atividades realizadas pelo laboratуrio de Leishmaniose e Doenзa de Chagas, do Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas da Amazфnia. 
O laboratуrio de Leishmaniose e Doenзa de Chagas foi fundado em 1974, e desde entгo tem passado por expansхes em suas linhas de pesquisa, com a obtenзгo de resultados relevantes para a sociedade alйm de contribuir na formaзгo de vбrios profissionais.
As dificuldades quanto а profilaxia e o tratamento da Leishmaniose e da Doenзa de Chagas, somadas a sua importвncia epidemiolуgica, a necessidade de monitoramento e expansгo dos conhecimentos destas doenзas parasitбrias sгo os alicerces que fundamentam as atividades realizadas pelo grupo de pesquisas. Desta maneira, vбrias бreas do conhecimento sгo abordadas dentro do Laboratуrio, convergindo para os conhecimentos sobre tripanossomatнdeos. Para a realizaзгo das atividades, equipamentos de uso comum, como freezers, banho maria, balanзa analнtica, cabine de fluxo laminar, centrifugas, estufa de crescimento, microscуpios e pipetadores automбticos sгo requeridos no cotidiano das pesquisas realizadas. Estes equipamentos precisam de manutenзгo preditiva e preventiva, como as calibraзхes periуdicas, trocas de peзas, dispositivos e filtros e limpezas especializadas. Alйm, da manutenзгo, muitos equipamentos precisam de reparos, as manutenзхes corretivas para voltarem a funcionar corretamente. Outros equipamentos sгo mais especнficos para cada linhas de pesquisas estabelecidas no Laboratуrio, como espectrofotфmetro, termocicladores, cuba de eletroforese. Estes tambйm precisam de manutenзгo preventiva, e alguns, de corretiva. A utilizaзгo destes equipamentos de forma calibrada e certificada implica na melhora dos trabalhos realizados pelo grupo de pesquisa, alйm de contribuir com a formaзгo apropriada dos alunos de pуs-graduaзгo que necessitam realizar seus trabalhos no Laboratуrio.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: I conferкncia Internacional sobre a Leishmaniose Tegumentar (CILeishTeg) / First International Conference on Cutaneous Leishmaniasis A look at the leishmaniasis in the Amazon region?More than half a century of pentavalent antimony!
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
On behalf of the Organizing Committee it is pleased invite you to the "1st International Conference on Cutaneous Leishmaniasis" event to be held in the period of 10 to 13 August 2015 at the National Institute for Amazonian Research - INPA, Bosque da Ciкncia Auditorium in Manaus - Amazonas - BR.
The meeting will bring to get herren owned national and international scientists to discuss the perspectives and challenges to be employed in the Surveillance and Control programs in accordance with the principles and guidelines of SUS ("Sistema Ъnico de Saъde"), promoting reflection on the epidemiological, parasitological, immunological, molecular diagnosis, treatment, technological innovation, prevention and control of cutaneous leishmaniasis, as well as the discussion of new treatment strategies more feasible and effective. The scientific program includes many aspects of the theme, includinglectures, roundtables, discussionofclinical cases and mini courses. The eventwill include presentation of scientific papers and registration on scientific annals. The ICCLeish of biannual feature will facilitate the diffusion of technological advances and innovation related to basic knowledge and applied aimed mainly at studies related to the diagnosis, treatment, prevention and control leishmaniasis.
Through this conference we intend to promote "Gaspar Vianna Award" for the best banner and oral presentationon innovation, encouraging studies in the area.
Come also to enjoy the natural beauty, typical food and hospitality of Manaus. We look forward to welcoming you!
www.iccleish.com
Antonia Maria Ramos Franco Pereira

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Programa Horizon 2020 - MSCA - RISE - 2016 (Research and Innovation Staff Exchange)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
The proposal is devoted to a development of smart drug-vector nanostructures (DVNs) based on stimuli-responsive inorganic, hybrid inorgano-organic nanomatrices, and polymer nanocapsules bearing new pharmaceutically active compounds (PhACs) and synthetic derivatives of natural PhACs. The innovative idea is the DVNs can enter target cancer cell or protozoan parasite infected cell through receptor mediated endocytosis and interact with distinct compartments of the cellular secretory pathway. Owing to adaptive drug release in response to variations in pH and redox environment, the parasite growth or cancer cells proliferation will be suppressed. For this purpose, strongly international and interdisciplinary VAHVISTUS consortium is created. Thus, principal objective of the proposal is to strengthen the existing international collaborations between the Consortium Partners and to establish new long-lasting international and inter-sectoral ones, to provide knowledge sharing through exchanges of research and innovation staff, and to create an intercontinental network in the area of smart DVNs for adaptive delivery to target cells. 6 academic organisations and 1 industrial partner of the Consortium from 3 MS/AC and 3 TC will develop intense and continuous knowledge sharing by cross-fertilisation of ideas through international and intersectoral secondments of staff at different carrier stages. The exchanges are well balanced between ER and ESR, men and women. The Proposal implementation is divided into 7 Work packages. A multicultural creative environment within the VAHVISTUS will contribute to make research and innovation an attractive carrier. Communication and dissemination activities as well as exploitation of results will be crucial within the VAHVISTUS. The Project results will enhance the competitiveness of European pharmaceutical industry, health care, and higher education. A Summer school will be organised on Smart Nanocarriers for Adaptive Drug Delivery.
Empresa envolvida: Farmak Joint-Stock Company/www.farmak.ua
Este programa envolve diversos paнses (Finlвndia, Itбlia, Ucrвnia, Brasil, EUA, Marrocos). Coordenado pela Universidade de Helsinki, Fi e apoiado pela Comunidade Europйia e FAPEAM, BR (Processo No. 062.00526.2016).

R.;FRANCO, A M R;FRANCO, ANTONIA M.R.;Franco, Antфnia Maria Ramos;RAMOS FRANCO, ANTФNIA MARIA;Franco, Antonia Maria Ramos;Franco Pereira, A M R;Pereira, Antonia Maria Ramos Franco;Pereira, A M R F

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: projeto multicкntrico Characterization of the immune response to CpGD35 in Cutaneous Leishmaniasis patients
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Activation of TLR9 initiates pro inflammatory reactions that results in the production of cytokine such as IFNalfa and IFNgama hat plays a protective role in cutaneous leishmaniasis, reducing the size of the lesion and enhancing the response to treatment. On the other hand, CL patients present a patent T cell mediated response revealed by specific cell proliferation and Th1-type cytokine expression after stimulation with leishmanial antigens. The hypothesis is that in vitro stimulation of PBMCs from CL patients with the TLR9 selective agonist CpG D35 will result in the significant increase of cell proliferation, the expression of Th1-type cytokines, and the IFNgama / IL-10 ratio. General Objectives:To assess the stimulatory capability of CpG ODN in both PBMCs and whole blood samples from CL patients, and determine which host genes are modulated in the CL lesions. Specific Objectives:Primary objectives:-To assess in vitro cell proliferation of PBMC from CL patients after CpG ODN stimulation. -To measure TNFα, IFNα, IFNgama, IL-10, IL-17, IL-23, and IP-10 production in the supernatant by CpG ODN stimulated PBMC and in the plasma after whole blood stimulation assay with CpG ODN.
-To characterize gene expression profile of the lesions in CL patients by nanostring. Secondary objectives:-To measure transcript levels of cytokine genes in PBMCs stimulated with CpG ODN.
Study Setting, Population and Sampling Strategy: L. major infected patients ? 15 individuals (I. Pasteur, Teheran, Iran)
L. tropica infected patients ? 15 individuals (I. Pasteur, Teheran, Iran)
L. braziliensis infected patients ? 15 individuals (Corte da Pedra, Brazil)
L. panamensisinfected patients ? 15 individuals (PECET, Medellin, Colombia
L. amazonensisinfected patiens ? 15 individuals (Manaos, Brazil)
Healthy non infected individuals - 15 individuals (WHOCC, Majadahonda, Spain) 

WHO Collaborating Centre for Leishmaniasis (ISCIII) - Drug For Neglected Disease initiative
Instituto de Salud Carlos III (ISCIII), Madrid
Fundaciуn Espaсola para la Cooperaciуn Internacional, Salud y Polнtica Social (FCSAI), Madrid

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Integrative development of smart drug-vector nanostructures for adaptive delivery to target cells
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Deadline Id: H2020-MSCA-RISE-2016 / Proposal acronym: VAHVISTUS Proposal number: 734759
Type of action: MSCA-RISE (RISE) Topic: MSCA-RISE-2016
Call: H2020-MSCA-RISE-2016 (Marie Skłodowska-Curie Research and Innovation Staff Exchange)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The proposal is devoted to a development of smart drug-vector nanostructures (DVNs) based on stimuli-responsive inorganic, hybrid inorgano-organic nanomatrices, and polymer nanocapsules bearing new pharmaceutically active compounds (PhACs) and synthetic derivatives of natural PhACs. The innovative idea is the DVNs can enter target cancer cell or protozoan parasite infected cell through receptor mediated endocytosis and interact with distinct compartments of the cellular secretory pathway. Owing to adaptive drug release in response to variations in pH and redox environment, the parasite growth or cancer cells proliferation will be suppressed. For this purpose, strongly international and interdisciplinary VAHVISTUS consortium is created. Thus, principal objective of the proposal is to strengthen the existing international collaborations between the Consortium Partners and to establish new long-lasting international and inter-sectoral ones, to provide knowledge sharing through exchanges of research and innovation staff, and to create an intercontinental network in the area of smart DVNs for adaptive delivery to target cells. 6 academic organisations and 1 industrial partner of the Consortium from 3 MS/AC and 3 TC will develop intense and continuous knowledge sharing by cross-fertilisation of ideas through international and intersectoral secondments of staff at different carrier stages. The exchanges are well balanced between ER and ESR, men and women. The Proposal implementation is divided into 7 Work packages. A multicultural creative environment within the VAHVISTUS will contribute to make research and innovation an attractive carrier. Communication and dissemination activities as well as exploitation of results will be crucial within the VAHVISTUS. The Project results will enhance the competitiveness of European pharmaceutical industry, health care, and higher education. A Summer school will be organised on Smart Nanocarriers for Adaptive Drug Delivery.

www.iccleish.com
Dear colleagues and friends,

On behalf of the Organizing Committee it is pleased invite you to the "1st International Conference on Cutaneous Leishmaniasis" event to be held in the period of 10 to 13 August 2015 at the National Institute for Amazonian Research - INPA, Bosque da Ciкncia Auditorium in Manaus - Amazonas - BR.
The meeting will bring to get herren owned national and international scientists to discuss the perspectives and challenges to be employed in the Surveillance and Control programs in accordance with the principles and guidelines of SUS ("Sistema Ъnico de Saъde"), promoting reflection on the epidemiological, parasitological, immunological, molecular diagnosis, treatment, technological innovation, prevention and control of cutaneous leishmaniasis, as well as the discussion of new treatment strategies more feasible and effective. The scientific program includes many aspects of the theme, includinglectures, roundtables, discussionofclinical cases and mini courses. The eventwill include presentation of scientific papers and registration on scientific annals. The ICCLeish of biannual feature will facilitate the diffusion of technological advances and innovation related to basic knowledge and applied aimed mainly at studies related to the diagnosis, treatment, prevention and control leishmaniasis.
Through this conference we intend to promote "Gaspar Vianna Award" for the best banner and oral presentationon innovation, encouraging studies in the area.
Come also to enjoy the natural beauty, typical food and hospitality of Manaus. We look forward to welcoming you!

Antonia Maria Ramos Franco Pereira
President of the 1st International Conference on Cutaneous Leishmaniasis
